page.title: 07SEVERN HOUSE FARM, BERKELEY
page.content: Sheltered behind the Severn Sea Wall lies the Silverthorn Family Farm which is a{mixed business}with a herd of 267 {Friesian}cows and 3 happy{Hereford bulls. The crops grown are wheat, barley and maize, taking up 400 of the 650 acre farm. {Chemicals}play an important part on the land at a time when other farmers are engaged in developing{organic methods. The working day for the family and the four employees begins at 6.30am and often ends as late as 10pm, seven days a week. The weekly rewards for these long hours can vary from{Â£80 to Â£1000. The family including the goldfish, cats and dogs, enjoy this way of life. This concern has also been hit by milk quotas when{The Third World peoples are suffering from famine and malnutrition.
